item.title: 美国经济忧虑令股市下滑，债券反弹：市场综述
item.description: 美国消费者信心指数再次令人失望，加剧了人们对全球最大经济体健康状况的担忧。国债反弹推动 10 年期国债收益率跌至今年最低水平。【原文：Stocks in Asia are broadly set to follow a drop in the US, where another disappointing consumer confidence reading fueled concern about the health of the world’s largest economy. A rally in Treasuries drove 10-year yields to their lowest levels this year.】

item.title: 超微公司迟交财务报告，缓解退市担忧
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer Inc.【原文：Super Micro Computer Inc. said it submitted outstanding financial reports to become compliant with Nasdaq Inc. rules, easing risks that the server maker will be delisted.】

item.title: 泰国央行预计将维持利率不变，但要求降息的呼声日益高涨
item.description: 人们普遍预计泰国央行将在周三维持其关键利率不变，但来自政府和包括国际货币基金组织在内的团体的压力与日俱增，要求进一步放宽政策以重振经济增长。【原文：The Bank of Thailand is widely expected to stand pat on its key interest rate on Wednesday, but there’s growing pressure from the government and groups including the International Monetary Fund for further easing to revive growth.】

item.title: 关税增长冲击迫在眉睫，交易员豪赌债券反弹
item.description: 债券交易商在连续数周保持中立后，开始通过押注市场大幅反弹来对冲可能出现的经济放缓。【原文：Bond traders are starting to hedge for a possible economic slowdown by placing wagers on a big market rally after weeks of just sitting tight and staying neutral.】

item.title: 特朗普开启新征税大门，纽约铜价跳涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普签署行政命令，指示商务部研究对金属征收关税的可能性之后，铜期货攀升。【原文：Copper futures climbed after President Donald Trump signed an executive action directing the Commerce Department to examine possible tariffs on the metal.】

item.title: 稀土价格持续走低，林纳斯公司利润下滑 85
item.description: 林纳斯稀土有限公司（Lynas Rare Earths Ltd.）上半年的利润同比下滑了 85%，原因是从风力涡轮机到军用硬件和电动汽车等各种产品所使用的稀土材料价格持续低迷。【原文：Lynas Rare Earths Ltd.’s first-half profit slumped 85% from the year before, as prices for the materials — used in everything from wind turbines to military hardware and electric vehicles — remain in the doldrums.】

item.title: 即使销售增长放缓，Coupang 利润仍超出预期
item.description: 韩国最大的电子商务公司 Coupang Inc. 第四季度的利润大幅超出预期，尽管销售增长速度低于预期。【原文：Coupang Inc., the largest e-commerce company focused on South Korea, handily beat profit estimates for the fourth quarter, even as sales grew more slowly than expected during the period.】

item.title: 特朗普将调查铜关税，为对金属征收新关税敞开大门
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统签署了一项行政措施，指示商务部研究可能对铜征收的关税，这是一系列旨在对特定行业征税的措施中最新的一项，这些措施将重塑全球供应链。【原文：President Donald Trump signed an executive action directing the Commerce Department to examine possible copper tariffs, the latest in a string of measures aimed at imposing sector-specific levies that offer to reshape global supply chains.】

item.title: Instacart 因令人失望的销售业绩和盈利前景而下跌
item.description: Instacart 公布的第四季度营收令人失望，预计当期调整后收益低于预期，尽管快递订单依然强劲，但其业务情况喜忧参半。【原文：Instacart posted disappointing fourth-quarter revenue and projected lower-than-expected adjusted earnings in the current period, offering a mixed picture about its business even as delivery orders remained robust.】

item.title: 华尔街银行家竞相从 50 亿美元的 CATL 交易中分一杯羹
item.description: 尽管银行家的费用很低，而且这家全球最大的电池制造商还被美国列入了黑名单，但由于近期缺乏数十亿美元的交易，CATL 在香港上市的竞争变得更加激烈。【原文：A lack of recent multibillion dollar deals made the race for a role on CATL’s Hong Kong listing even more competitive, despite low fees for bankers and a US blacklisting hanging over the world’s biggest battery maker.】

item.title: 公司调整后星巴克将外包部分技术工作
item.description: 星巴克公司（Starbucks Corp.）在进行重组后，将把一些技术工作外包出去，这次重组导致公司裁员 1100 人。【原文：Starbucks Corp. will outsource some technology work following a reorganization that resulted in 1,100 job cuts across its corporate ranks.】

item.title: 联邦技术人员辞职抗议马斯克的 DOGE 努力
item.description: 美国数字服务部是白宫的一个办公室，最近几周被改建成了埃隆-马斯克的政府效率部，该部门的一批工人已经辞职，抗议这位亿万富翁解散联邦机构和解雇工人的行为。【原文：A group of workers from the US Digital Service, a White House office that was refashioned into Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency in recent weeks, have resigned in protest of the billionaire’s actions to dismantle federal agencies and dismiss workers.】

item.title: 新泽西州州长提出削减支出 581 亿美元的预算案
item.description: 新泽西州州长菲尔-墨菲（Phil Murphy）希望在来年的预算中控制支出。【原文：New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy is looking to rein in spending as part of his budget for the upcoming year.】

item.title: 特朗普的威胁将斯塔默推向更具全球性的军事议程
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）一上台就承诺要提高生活水平和发展英国经济。但现在，他的首相任期有了一个紧迫而完全不同的重点：在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普颠覆的动荡世界秩序中维护欧洲安全。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer swept to power promising to raise living standards and grow the British economy. But now his premiership has an urgent and altogether different focus: preserving European security in a volatile world order upended by US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 阿根廷 12 月经济再次超出预期
item.description: 阿根廷 12 月份的经济增长超过预期，巩固了该国在哈维尔-米莱伊总统领导下在今年最后一个季度的反弹势头。【原文：Argentina’s economy expanded more than expected in December, solidifying the country’s bounceback in the last quarter of the year under President Javier Milei’s watch.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟在重组中关闭三家视频游戏工作室
item.description: 华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.【原文：Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. is closing three of its video-game studios and halting work on a highly anticipated Wonder Woman title in a bid to boost profitability of the division.】

item.title: Uniswap 称美国证券交易委员会已结束对去中心化金融公司的调查
item.description: 以太坊上最大的去中心化交易平台的创建者 Uniswap Labs 表示，美国证券交易委员会已经结束了对该公司的调查，没有采取任何执法行动。【原文：Uniswap Labs, the creator of the largest decentralized trading platform on Ethereum, said the US Securities and Exchange Commission has closed its investigation into the company with no enforcement action.】

item.title: 智利发生大停电，主要铜矿受到影响
item.description: 周二下午，智利发生大面积停电事故，全国大部分地区陷入黑暗，一些世界顶级铜矿受到影响，促使政府召开紧急会议。【原文：Chile was hit by a massive power failure that left most of the country in the dark on Tuesday afternoon, affecting some of the world’s top copper mines and prompting the government to call an emergency meeting.】

item.title: 莫桑比克扩大基本商品免税范围以缓解紧张局势
item.description: 莫桑比克将对生活必需品免征增值税的期限延长至今年年底，以缓解消费者的支出压力。【原文：Mozambique extended a value-added tax exemption on essential goods until the end of the year to ease spending pressures on consumers that have sparked violent protests in the southern African nation.】

item.title: 德国再保险公司慕尼黑再保险公司将通过回购和分红返还 46 亿欧元
item.description: 德国再保险业巨头慕尼黑再保险公司宣布，计划通过新的回购计划和增加股息向股东返还约 46 亿欧元（48 亿美元）。【原文：German reinsurance giant Munich Re announced plans to return about €4.6 billion ($4.8 billion) to shareholders through a new buyback program and an increased dividend.】

item.title: 蒙特利尔银行称关税阴云阻碍交易和贷款增长
item.description: 据加拿大最大的银行之一称，贸易紧张局势正在阻碍交易、投资和贷款增长，虽然关税战的全面影响尚无法预估，但它已经对加拿大金融业的前景造成了阻碍。【原文：Trade tensions are stalling deals, investments and loan growth, according to one of Canada’s biggest banks, and while the full impact of a tariff war is impossible to game out, it’s already putting a damper on the outlook for the country’s financial sector.】

item.title: 杠杆 ETF 损失高达 40%，华尔街赌徒惨遭淘汰
item.description: 在大选后的牛市中，华尔街的产品经理们大量制造高风险、高回报的交易所交易基金，风靡一时。【原文：They were all the rage on the way up: high-risk, high-return exchange-traded funds, minted in bulk by Wall Street product managers in the euphoria of the post-election bull market.】

item.title: 必和必拓启动 108 亿美元计划防止智利铜业下滑
item.description: 必和必拓集团将在智利启动一项价值 108 亿美元的大规模投资计划，对一座老化的铜厂进行大修，因为这家全球最有价值的矿业公司正在与矿石质量下降作斗争。【原文：BHP Group will kick off a massive $10.8 billion investment program in Chile with the overhaul of an aging copper plant as the world’s most valuable mining company battles declining ore quality.】

item.title: Robinhood 首席执行官特内夫称金融监管有利于公司发展
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc.首席执行官弗拉德-特涅夫（Vlad Tenev）说，他的公司因加密货币业务而受到美国金融监管机构的调查，该公司受益于政府的监督。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. Chief Executive Officer Vlad Tenev said that his firm, which has been probed by US financial regulators over its cryptocurrency operations, benefits from government oversight.】

item.title: Hooters 破产威胁甚至危及证券化债券持有人
item.description: 据知情人士透露，美国 Hooters 公司发行的资产担保债券的持有人正在就他们的权利和选择寻求建议，因为这家休闲餐饮特许经营公司正准备在未来几个月内申请破产。【原文：Holders of asset-backed bonds issued by a Hooters of America unit are seeking advice on their rights and options as the casual-dining franchise prepares a potential bankruptcy filing in the coming months, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 巴尔金称美联储保持 "适度限制 "是适当的
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）表示，央行必须继续坚定地与通胀作斗争，并指出了长期通胀阻力的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Tom Barkin said the central bank must remain determined in its inflation fight and flagged the risk of longer-term inflationary headwinds.】

item.title: 戴比尔斯与博茨瓦纳签署营销协议，推动天然钻石需求增长
item.description: 德比尔斯公司和博茨瓦纳政府将共同资助一项营销活动，以恢复对天然钻石的需求。【原文：De Beers and Botswana’s government will jointly fund a marketing campaign to resuscitate demand for natural diamonds.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮推动需求增长，ASM 销售额预测超出预期
item.description: 由于人工智能的蓬勃发展推动了对这家荷兰半导体设备制造商产品的需求，ASM International NV 的第一季度收入预期超过了预期。【原文：ASM International NV’s first-quarter revenue forecast beat estimates as an artificial intelligence boom drives demand for the Dutch semiconductor-equipment maker’s products.】

item.title: Grifols 任命独立董事贝尔纳为主席
item.description: Grifols SA 任命一名独立董事担任非执行董事长，这是这家西班牙公司为改善公司治理而采取的最新措施。【原文：Grifols SA has named an independent director to become non-executive chairwoman, the Spanish company’s latest step to improve its corporate governance.】

item.title: 泰晤士水务要求 Castle Water 和 KKR 进行详细的股权竞购
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着拥有负债累累的公用事业公司泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）进程的推进，Castle Water Ltd. 和 KKR & Co.【原文：Castle Water Ltd. and KKR & Co. have been invited to provide more detail on their bids as the process for owning the debt-laden utility Thames Water progresses, according to people familiar with the matter.】
